Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.root()¶

Initialize root endpoint.

Returns:

Object with message

Return type:

dict

async main.startup() → None¶

Initialize connection with redis db. :return: None. :rtype: None

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶

Creates new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves list of user’s contacts.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

Returns:

List of user’s contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_with_email(email: str, db: Session, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves contacts with the specified email for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email of the contacts to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to get the contacts for.

Returns:

Contacts with the specified email for a specific user.

Return type:

List[Contact]

Retrieves contacts with the specified lastname for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • lastname (str) – The lastname of the contacts to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to get the contacts for.

Returns:

Contacts with the specified lastname for a specific user.

List[Contact]

  • user (User) – The user to get the contacts for.

contacts with recent birthdays for a specific user.

src.repository.contacts.has_birthday_next_week(birthday: date) → bool¶

Check if specific birthday is in next 7 days.

Parameters:

birthday (date) – Birthday to check.

Returns:

True if birthday is in next 7 days or False if not.

Return type:

bool

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates avatar for user with specific email.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – Avatar path.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

User with updated avatar.

User

Parameters:

  • token (str | None) – New refresh token.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Initialize db query to get contact that belong to specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Data for creation new contact.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

  • current_user (User, optional) – The user to create contact for, defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)

Returns:

Newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Initialize db query to get user’s contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int, optional) – ID to get contact, defaults to Path(description=”The ID of the contact to get”, ge=1).

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The user to get contact related for, defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact does not exist with such ID.

Returns:

contact with specific ID.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[Contact]¶

Initialize db query to get list of user’s contacts.

Parameters:

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

  • current_user (User, optional) – The user to retrieve contacts for, defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)

Returns:

List of user’s contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts_by_email(email: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[Contact]¶

Initialize db query to get list of contacts with specific email.

Parameters:

  • email (str, optional) – Email to get contacts with, defaults to Path(description=”Show contacts with email”, min_length=2, max_length=50)

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

  • current_user (User, optional) – The user to get list of contacts related with, defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)

Returns:

List of contacts with specific email.

Return type:

List[Contact]

List of contacts with birthday next week related to specific user

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Initialize db query to remove contact with specific ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int, optional) – ID to remove contact with, defaults to Path(description=”The ID of the contact to delete”, ge=1)

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

  • current_user (User, optional) – The user to remove contact related for, defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact does not exist with such ID

Returns:

Removed contact.

Return type:

Contact

Dictionary with message.

dict

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Initialize db query to update contact with specific ID.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactUpdate) – Data for updating new contact.

  • contact_id (int, optional) – ID to change contact with, defaults to Path(description=”The ID of the contact to put”, ge=1)

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

  • current_user (User, optional) – The user to update contact related for, defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact does not exist with such ID.

Returns:

Updated contact.

Return type:

Contact

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Confirmes email in user profile.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Token to confirm email.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

HTTPException – If user with such email does not exist.

Returns:

Dictionary with message.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.users.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Initialize db query to login user with specific data.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, optional) – Credentials data to login usesr, defaults to Depends()

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

Raises:

  • HTTPException – If user with such email does not exist.

  • HTTPException – If user has not confirmed his email.

  • HTTPException – If passwird is not correct.

Returns:

Dictionary with access_token, refresh_token and token_type.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → User¶

Gets information about user.

Parameters:

current_user (User, optional) – User to get information about, defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)

Returns:

User.

Return type:

User

async src.routes.users.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Refresh token for specific user.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials, optional) – Credentials to update token, defaults to Security(security)

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

Raises:

HTTPException – If user’s refresh_token is not equal token from request.

Returns:

Dictionary with access_token, refresh_token and token_type.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.users.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Sends email for email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – Email to confirm.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – BackgroundTasks to sent email background.

  • request (Request) – Request to get url from.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

Returns:

Dictionary with message.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.users.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Initialize db query to create new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – Data for creating new user.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – BackgroundTasks to sent email background.

  • request (Request) – Request to get url from.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

Raises:

HTTPException – If user with such email already exists.

Returns:

Dictionary with newly created user and message.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User¶

Initialize db query to update user’s avatar.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile, optional) – File to update, defaults to File()

  • current_user (User, optional) – User to avatar update, defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

Returns:

User with updated avatar.

Return type:

User

REST API database Auth¶

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶

Creates new ACCESS token with specific data and specific time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to create token with.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float], optional) – Seconds to new token will work, defaults to None

Returns:

Newly created ACCESS token.

Return type:

str

Creates new REFRESH token with specific data and specific time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to create token with.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float], optional) – Seconds to new token will work, defaults to None

Returns:

Newly created REFRESH token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str¶

Gets email from refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – Refresh token to decode.

Raises:

  • HTTPException – If scope is not equal ‘refresh_token’.

  • HTTPException – If credentiales are not valid.

Returns:

Email from refresh token.

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User¶

Get user from token.

Parameters:

  • token (str, optional) – Token to get user from, defaults to Depends(oauth2_scheme)

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session, defaults to Depends(get_db)

Raises:

  • credentials_exception – If credentiales are not valid.

  • credentials_exception – If scope is not equal ‘access_token’.

  • credentials_exception – If there are no email in data.

  • credentials_exception – If user does not exist.

Returns:

User from token.

Return type:

User

Gets email from specific token

Parameters:

token (str) – Token to get email from.

Raises:

HTTPException – Invalid token for email verification

Returns:

Email

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Get hash string from password.

Parameters:

password (str) – Password to get hash from.

Returns:

Hash string from password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

Verifies if plain_password has hash equal hashed_password

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Plain password to check.

  • hashed_password (str) – Hashed password to compare with.

Returns:

Returns True if plain password has hash equal hashed_password or False if not.

Return type:

bool

REST API services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str) → None¶

Sends confirmation message to specific user.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email to send message to.

  • username (str) – Username to send message to.

  • host (str) – Host for recovery link.
